summary.body: Have any other Barbican-based cyclists been hassled recently by the City Police?  So far in a four week period I've been informally cautioned for something that - on investigation - wasn't even an offence and then nearly been knocked off my bike by a motor cycle patrol officer who warned me, in inappropriate language, not to commit an offence that I wasn't going to commit anyway. This latter incident was witnessed by my wife, who was cycling behind me, and who got more annoyed than me because she was sure I was going to be injured. One of the joys of living in the Barbican is not to have to rely on the car all the time. I cycle about 150 miles a week and - yes - I know cyclists can be a real pain and hazard. I try hard to respect all other road users and pedestrians - yes, even the ones permanently glued to mobile phones who cross roads looking the other way - and I wondered whether others have noticed a change in City Police attitudes. I stupidly failed to get the shoulder numbers of both officers involved but I am considering chasing up the details of the motor cycle officer because he was both dangerous and offensive.

summary.body: Good Afternoon Residents, I have been ask to clarify the situation with regards age of the volunteers and having taken advice it is as follows.  There is no age limit for any person volunteering to do this work, but as a rule of thumb Thames Valley Police have put an upper age limit of 80 years young. Kind Regards John

summary.body: Drug, Alcohol and Internet Safety Event  City of London Drug Action Team With parenting, family and social issues such us drug awareness and internet safety at the front of our minds more and more, the Drug Action Team will be hosting two events for parents to attend - offering practical, useful advice on the issues that really matter, please come along and share your concerns with people who care & understand. 1st event Golden Lane Community Centre (Opposite Great Arthur House - Tower Block) Golden Lane Date and time: Tuesday 9th October at 6.30 pm 2nd event Middlesex Street Community Hall Middlesex Street Estate Date and time: Tuesday 17th October at 6.30 pm Both events will feature discussions & questions and will be friendly and informal
